title: Fairly heavy rains above 75 mm likely in parts of the island
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts. Fairly heavy falls above 75 mm are likely at some places in the Sabaragamuwa province and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts.

title: Economics or entrepreneurship must serve humanity, not just wealth – PM
byline: The Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, stated that despite societal tendencies to prioritize monetary value, economics and entrepreneurship should be disciplines rooted in humanity, and the concept of a “care economy” serves as a good example of this approach.

title: Bus carrying 20 Sri Lankan workers catches fire in Israel  – Ambassador
byline: A bus transporting 20 Sri Lankan youths employed in the agricultural sector in Israel caught fire last morning (18) near Kiryat Malakhi, according to Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Israel, Nimal Bandara.

title: Police impose traffic restrictions in Ruwanwella
byline: The annual Esala Maha Perahera of the Yatanwala Swarna Walukarama Temple, located in the Ruwanwella Police Division, is scheduled to take place tonight (19) from 10:00 PM to 12:00 AM.

title: US envoy says Syria and Israel agree to ceasefire as Druze minority and Bedouin clans clash in Syria
byline: U.S. envoy to Syria Tom Barrack said early Saturday that Israel and Syria had agreed to a ceasefire following Israel’s intervention this week in fighting between Syrian government forces and rival armed groups.

title: US tech CEO suspended after Coldplay concert embrace goes viral
byline: A US tech company has placed its CEO on leave after a big screen embrace at a Coldplay concert - rumoured to involve two of its employees - went viral.

title: Temporary driving licenses for tourists to be issued at BIA
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has announced that a new system for issuing temporary driving licenses to tourists arriving in Sri Lanka will be launched at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake starting in August.

title: One missing after fishing boat caught in strong winds
byline: A fisherman has been reported missing after a boat that set out to sea from the Beruwala Fisheries Harbour encountered strong winds early this morning (19).

title: Shooting incident reported outside nightclub in Thalawathugoda
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in front of a nightclub in the Thalawathugoda area in the early hours of this morning (19).

title: Pakistan extends airspace ban for Indian flights till August 24
byline: Pakistan has extended the closure of its airspace for flights operated by Indian airlines by another month till August 24, the Pakistan Airports Authority (PAA) said.

title: Bus carrying 20 Sri Lankan workers catches fire in Israel; no serious injuries – Ambassador
byline: A bus transporting 20 Sri Lankan youths employed in the agricultural sector in Israel caught fire last morning (18) near Kiryat Malakhi, according to Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Israel, Nimal Bandara.

title: US Embassy strengthens regional efforts to combat synthetic drug threat
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka, in collaboration with the National Dangerous Drugs Control Board (NDDCB), has concluded a two-week regional training initiative focused on identifying and analyzing synthetic drugs and new psychoactive substances, particularly fentanyl and its analogs—substances that have become an urgent global concern.

title: Thalawathugoda shooting: Arrested excise officer and businessman remanded
byline: The Kaduwela Magistrate’s Court has ordered the remand of an excise officer and a businessman who were arrested in connection with a shooting incident that occurred near a nightclub in the Thalawathugoda area early this morning (19).

title: Foreign Minister meets Indian actor Ravi Mohan to discuss film tourism
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Tourism, and Foreign Employment, Vijitha Herath, has held a meeting with renowned Indian actor and producer Ravi Mohan, also known as Jayam Ravi, along with acclaimed singer Keneesha Francis.

title: Shah Rukh Khan injured on ‘King’ sets? Advised one-month rest: Reports
byline: Actor Shah Rukh Khan recently suffered a back injury while filming an action sequence for his upcoming film, ‘King’.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for strong winds and rough seas in the areas extending from Puttalam to Pottuvil via Colombo, Galle, and Hambantota.

title: Sri Lanka’s rubber exporters seek tariff relief to compete in US market
byline: Ahead of the August 1 deadline for further negotiations on the tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, the Sri Lankan rubber exporters said they faced the threat of losing the US market unless a better deal was worked out.

title: MP Jagath Vithana’s son arrested
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Member of Parliament Jagath Vithana’s son has been arrested by officers of the Panadura Walana Anti-Vice Unit.

title: Report of inquiry committee probing Deshabandu to be submitted to Speaker
byline: The final report of the Committee of Inquiry appointed to inquire and report its findings on suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, in respect of acts of gross abuse of power, is scheduled to be handed over to the Speaker of Parliament within the coming week.

title: Senior DIG Nilantha Jayawardena dismissed from service
byline: The National Police Commission has decided to remove former State Intelligence Service (SIS) chief, Senior DIG Nilantha Jayawardena, from the Sri Lanka Police service following a disciplinary inquiry into his actions prior to the Easter Sunday bomb attacks.

title: Trump sues Wall Street Journal over Epstein report, seeks $10 billion
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump sued the Wall Street Journal and its owners including Rupert Murdoch for at least $10 billion on Friday, over the newspaper’s report that his name was on a 2003 birthday greeting for Jeffrey Epstein that included a sexually suggestive drawing and a reference to secrets they shared.

title: Goal is to reduce number of students in a classroom to 25-30: PM Harini
byline: The Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, stated that the government’s goal is to limit the number of students in a classroom to between 25 to 30, emphasizing that it is not possible to deliver quality education in classrooms with around 50-60 students.

title: Three dead and 3 injured as van topples down precipice
byline: A total of three persons, including two women, have reportedly died after a van veered off the road and toppled down a precipice in the Karambaketiya area of Ududumbara, police said.
